perturbation.explanation: The original payment terms provided specific deadlines for payments to the Celebrity's agent. By extending the initial payment deadline to 30 days, delaying the second payment to 120 days, and deferring the final payment until after the production session, the modified text increases the payment timelines. This creates a legal contradiction if state laws require shorter payment periods for services rendered, potentially violating prompt payment laws. These laws are in place to protect service providers from undue delays in compensation.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Georgia Prompt Payment Act (O.C.G.A. § 13-11-1 et seq.) and general principles of contract law regarding timely payment for services.

perturbation.original_text:
A. HDS shall have the right to terminate this Agreement upon ten (10) days prior written notice to Celebrity in 
the event Celebrity fails to perform the duties set forth in Paragraph 4 hereof or breaches any other 
covenant or agreement set forth herein and fails to cure same (if curable) within seven (7) days of receipt of 
written notice. Such termination shall relieve HDS of its obligation to provide any further consideration 
pursuant to this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
A. HDS shall have the right to terminate this Agreement upon two (2) days prior written notice to Celebrity in 
the event Celebrity fails to perform the duties set forth in Paragraph 4 hereof or breaches any other 
covenant or agreement set forth herein and fails to cure same (if curable) within one (1) days of receipt of 
written notice. Such termination shall relieve HDS of its obligation to provide any further consideration 
pursuant to this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the notice period for termination to two days and the cure period to one day creates a contradiction with standard contract law principles requiring reasonable notice and opportunity to cure a breach. Many jurisdictions mandate a longer, more reasonable timeframe for such actions, especially when dealing with professional service agreements. This change prejudices the Celebrity's rights and may be deemed unconscionable.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General principles of contract law regarding reasonable notice and opportunity to cure, potentially violating implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing under Georgia law.

perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates a 30-day notice of cancellation for the insurance policies and requires HDS to provide proof of insurance within 5 days of a request. Reducing the cancellation notice to 10 days and extending the timeframe for providing the certificate of insurance to 30 days creates potential conflicts with standard insurance regulations and industry practices. A shorter cancellation notice may violate minimum notification periods required by state insurance laws, while the extended timeframe for providing proof of insurance increases the Celebrity's risk exposure by delaying confirmation of coverage.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Georgia insurance regulations regarding minimum cancellation notice periods (depending on the specific policy type) and general principles of risk management and due diligence.
